title: hydrological connectivity and basin morphometry influence seasonal water-chemistry variations in tundra ponds of the northwestern hudson bay lowlands
connectivity_metric: oblique aerial photos, water isotope tracers, water-level loggers
predictors: water chemistry (major ions, nutrients, chl-a, suspendend sediments, pH)

title: influence of a drought event on hydrological characteristics of a small estuary on the amazon mangrove coast
connectivity_def: temporal and spatial gradiants of water quality, nuts, and chl-a
predictors: spatial: sector, temporal: season, month, tide phase
notes: hyperheic zone briefly mentioned in discussion - having to do with freshwater stored in mangrove sediments that are released one ebb tide

title: periphyton response to simulated nonpoint source pollution: local over regional control
temporal_def: more than one season, across two years
predictors: nutrient addition, road salt, temporal synchrony
primary_productivity_metric: periphyton biomass (chl-a, ADFM); community respiration, net community metabolism, synchrony in biomass between habitat pairs
data_analysis_method: one-way ANOVA (nutrients on microbial community); paired samples BACI analysis (nutrients on algal biomass -ash free dry mass and chl-a, APA, and metabolism - salt trials only); Pearson product moment correlation (synchrony in biomass, APA and metabolism between habitat pairs)
notes: artificial substrates: in situ bio assay systems (tiles); no discussion about connectivity, experiments conducted in individual habitats

title: short-term succession of aquatic plant species richness along ecosystem productivity and dispersal gradients in shallow lakes
temporal coherence between lake and landscape primary productivity
temporal_def: more than one year, continuous measurements
connectivity_metric: aquatic and terrestrial primary productivity indices
connectivity_def: coherence magnitude and phase difference between chlorophyll a and NDVI
predictors: coefficient of variation in NDVI and variables associated with modulation of flows between lake and the landscape
responses: lake–landscape coherence magnitude and phase relationships
notes: connectivity not mentioned much and perhaps connectivity type '0' is more appropriate; data figure shows log10 mean chl-a x-axis and partial residuals on y-axis, figure does not identify lakes

title: trophic state and water quality in the danube floodplain lake (kopacki rit nature park, croatia) in relation to hydrological connectivity
study_type: observational, literature review, laboratory experiments - growth response of algae after nutrient additions
predictors: sediment, hydrology, water quality, nutrients,  bacterial abundance, phytoplankton chlorophyll, invasive invertebrates
data_analysis_method: trophic state indices of secchi dephth, total phosphorus, phytoplankton chloropyll,and nitrogen
notes: article in a book, article has original research and some results are lab based, evaluating growth response of algae after nutrient additions in laboaratory,  other data brought in through lit review but data not collected across same spatial and temporal scale
include_exclude_reason: criteria metric - original research is laboratory based

title: flood disturbance affects macroinvertebrate food chain length in an alluvial river floodplain
connectivity_metric: time since last flood, flooding frequency
predictors: time since last flood, flooding frequency, habitat size, biofilm standing crop, POM
data_analysis_method: GLMM, isotope mixing models, isotope niche indices
notes: data available upon request; modeled flood frequency and time elapsed since last flood

title: tracking the resource pulse: movement responses of fish to dynamic floodplain habitat in a tropical river
connectivity_metric: distance from home, distance on floodplain
predictors: water depth, water coverage, periphyton/vegetation coverage, temperature
data_analysis_method: classification and regression tree modeling, GAM to describe temporal patterns of each habitat variable, GAMMS for fish movement
notes: cool study - focus is on fish movement on flood plain; not sure its relevant withough chl-a

title: the impact of surface water exchange on the nutrient and particle dynamics in side-arms along the river danube, austria
temporal_def: more than one year, continuous measurements
connectivity_metric: average annual duration (day per year) of upstream surface connection of the different floodplain water bodies with the main channel, and water age
predictors: average annual duration (day per year) of upstream surface connection of the different floodplain water bodies with the main channel, and water age
responses: conductance, geochemistry, nutrients, particle concentration, chl-a

title: the danube restoration project: functional aspects and planktonic productivity in the floodplain system
primary_productivity_metric: chl-a, bacteria, primary production (incubations) and field extrapolated
data_analysis_method: theoretical water retention time calculation, primary production model, regression analyses and curve estimations for significant relationships

title: spatial dissimilarities in plankton structure and function during flood pulses in a semi-arid floodplain wetland system
responses: structural variables (densities and species composition),  functional variables (primary prouductivity and respiration), abiotic conditions
data_analysis_method: PCA, nMDS, ANOSIM (compositional similarities of phyto and zoop communities

title: longitudinal spatial variation in ecological conditions in an in-channel floodplain river system during flow pulses
connectivity_def: spatial patterns of abiotic and biotic parameters
predictors: hydrogeomorphological characteristics, longitudinal variation of the measured environmental drivers
primary_productivity_metric: cell density (cyano density, diatom density, green algae density, cryptomonads density); plankton respiration, gross primary productivity, GPP/Pr ratio
food_web: cryptomonads, protozoans, rotifers, copepods and cladocerans
notes: range of relative depth of 90 study lakes reported with mean and standard deviation

title: biological responses to recent eutrophication and hydrologic changes in xingyun lake, southwest china
data_analysis_method: Constrained incremental sum of squares (CONISS), DCA, PCA (for community variations), broken-stick model to determine signif. Of PCA axes, RDA

title: effects of lake-basin morphological and hydrological characteristics on the eutrophication of shallow lakes in eastern china
metal pollution in the pearl river estuary and implications for estuary management: the influence of hydrological connectivity associated with estuarine mixing
data_analysis_method: pearson's correlation analysis, multiple linear regression, hierarchial clustering, coefficient of variance to describe the spatial variability
notes: water boday and site size not defined but could estimate water body/site size from map; riverine inputs to estuary are regulated but estuary itself is not; percent of variance of eigenvalues exists in table 1
